Package controller

Class HomeController

java.lang.Object
controller.HomeController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class HomeController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
Class that contains event handlers, controller methods, and logical implementation that will redirect the user to appropriate forms for adding appointments or customers, and selecting an appointment or customer to modify or delete.

  • Constructor Details

    • HomeController

      public HomeController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes the controller with the necessary setup for the main screen. Populates the customers and appointments tables, and sets default radio button selections. Also initializes the report combo box based on the selected report type.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an exception occurs during initialization.

    • populateAppointmentTable

      void populateAppointmentTable()
      Populates the appointments table based on the selected time range. Clears existing appointments and loads new ones accordingly.

    • createReport

      private void createReport()
      Creates and displays the report based on the selected report type and options. Resets the table view, then formats and populates the view with the relevant data. Updates the report result label with the total number of records in the report.

    • getAppointmentToModify

      public static Appointment getAppointmentToModify()
      Retrieves the selected appointment for modification.
      Returns:
      The appointment to be modified.

    • getCustomerToModify

      public static Customer getCustomerToModify()
      Retrieves the selected customer for modification.
      Returns:
      The customer to be modified.

    • onAddAppointmentAction

      void onAddAppointmentAction()
      Handles the action when the "Add Appointment" button is pressed. Sets the appointment to be modified to null (if selected) and switches to the appointment scene.

    • onAddCustomerAction

      void onAddCustomerAction()
      Handles the action when the "Add Customer" button is pressed. Sets the customer to be modified to null (if selected) and switches to the customer scene.

    • onModifyAppointmentAction

      void onModifyAppointmentAction()
      Handles the action when the "Modify Appointment" button is pressed. Gets the selected appointment, sets it as the appointment to be modified, and switches to the appointment scene.

    • onModifyCustomerAction

      void onModifyCustomerAction()
      Handles the action when the "Modify Customer" button is pressed. Gets the selected customer, sets it as the customer to be modified, and switches to the customer scene.

    • onRemoveAppointmentAction

      void onRemoveAppointmentAction()
      Handles the action when the "Remove Appointment" button is pressed. Retrieves the selected appointment, prompts the user for confirmation, and removes the appointment if the user confirms the deletion. Displays appropriate alerts for errors and successful deletions. Updates the appointments table after a successful deletion.

    • onRemoveCustomerAction

      void onRemoveCustomerAction()
      Handles the action when the "Remove Customer" button is pressed. Retrieves the selected customer, checks for associated appointments, prompts the user for confirmation, and removes the customer if the user confirms the deletion. Displays appropriate alerts for errors and successful deletions. Clears the observable list and updates the customers table after a successful deletion.

    • switchToAppointmentScene

      void switchToAppointmentScene() throws IOException
      Switches the application view to the Appointment Scene. Loads the AppointmentMenu.fxml file and sets it as the new scene for the primary stage. Hides the current stage, sets the new title, and shows the updated stage.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during loading.

    • switchToCustomerScene

      void switchToCustomerScene() throws IOException
      Switches the application view to the Customer Menu Scene. Loads the CustomerMenu.fxml file and sets it as the new scene for the primary stage. Hides the current stage, sets the new title, and shows the updated stage.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an error occurs during loading.
